alert.note: Alert for Western Greenbrier (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 10 at 3:51AM EST until March 13 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Western Greenbrier County. * WHEN...From late Friday night through late Saturday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The cold wind chills as low as 10 below zero could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Watch means there is a potential for significant snow...sleet...or ice accumulations that may impact travel. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or your favorite source of weather information for the latest updates. Additional details can be found at www.weather.gov/blacksburg.
